tutorial.title: Mortgage Payments and Amortization Schedule
tutorial.scenario:
This tutorial shows how to use the Time Value of Money and Amortization modes to:

  1. Calculate the monthly payments on a 30-year loan starting in May.
  2. Generate an amortization schedule for the first three years of the loan.

Play
tutorial.part: Part 1. Calculate the monthly payment with a loan amount of $150,000 and 7% APR.
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries.
Enter the number of periods (in this case 360, since the loan is for 30 years), and then press the N button.
Enter the periodic interest rate (in this case 7/12, since payments are made on a monthly basis), and then press the = button followed by the I/Y button.
Enter the loan amount (in this case 150000), and then press the PV button.
Press the CPT button and then the PMT button to solve for the monthly payment.
tutorial.part: Part 2. Generate an amortization schedule for the first three years of the loan. If the first payment is in May, the first year has eight payment periods and the following years have twelve payment periods each.
tutorial.step: Press the AMORT button to access the amortization worksheet.
Press ↓, enter 8 (since the first year has eight payment periods), and then press the ENTER button to set the ending period to 8.
Press ↓ to display the balance at the end of the first year (after 8 payments).
Press ↓ to display the principal paid during the first year.
Press ↓ to display the interest paid during the first year.
Press ↓, enter 9 (since this is the beginning of the second year), and then press the ENTER button to change the beginning period to 9.
Press ↓, enter 20 (since the second year ends after 20 periods), and then press the ENTER button to change the ending period to 20.
Press ↓ to display the balance at the end of the second year (after 20 payments).
Press ↓ to display the principal paid during the second year.
Press ↓ to display the interest paid during the second year.
Press ↓, enter 21 (since this is the beginning of the third year), and then press the ENTER button to change the beginning period to 21.
Press ↓, enter 32 (since the third year ends after 32 periods), and then press the ENTER button to change the ending period to 32.
Press ↓ to display the balance at the end of the third year (after 32 payments).
Press ↓ to display the principal paid during the third year.
Press ↓ to display the interest paid during the third year.
